description:
The ambiance and food here is wonderful! Great small dishes to share that are always fresh and delicious! The staff and owner are very friendly and knowledgeable about Italian wines which are phenomenal here.
InoVino is wonderful for a date night or gathering together with friends and the atmosphere feels intimate and comfortable.
The bread, prosciutto, pizza and salads are scrumptious and I never leave I satisfied! I highly recommend checking this little place out for a memorable experience that will make you feel you are in Italy no doubt!
Love that place!
author: Marlie W.

description:
Very sweet, fresh, happy atmosphere in ma&pa neighborhood Cole Valley. 

We just returned home from Rome and were missing the ((amazing)) food; InoVino's straciatella pizza came in at a close second after our favorite pizzeria in Rome - Buffetto's. Other things not to miss are their version of an Aperol Spritz and the almonds. 

Will be back soon to try more. (Didn't care much for the crostini; the carciofi artichokes were good but missing something.) 

Staff is very friendly but slightly too quick on the takeaway. This is a very American habit of taking the plate while some are still nibbling. Does not happen in Italy.

Very convenient to N-Judah stop.
author: Camille L.

description: As the description states, it's an italian wine bar. So you've got... italian wines and food. But it's all quite tasty and there's even some outdoor seating which is something of a rarity in the city. We split a hard cheese, some white bean crostini, and a few glasses of wine. I'm decidedly a novice when it comes to wine and the staff was friendly and knowledgable. Really quite pleasant.
author: Misha T.

description:
It was one of the boys birthdays and he arranged for a pre-dinner happy hour at InoVino. He was the first one there, so luckily was able to order a bunch of things from the HH menu. I was the second to arrive on Friday, March 23rd around 6pm. He was already sitting at the tiny bar in front of the kitchen.

Happy Hour: Monday to Friday 4pm to 6pm and Saturday to Sunday 3pm to 6pm
*2014 Chianti Rufina, Bascianp, Toscana ($7)
*2014 Primitivo Poggio Basso, Pugilia ($7) x3
*Chicken Liver Pate on Bruschetta ($7)
*Grana Padano Cheese, Honey, Walnut Bread ($5)
*Pizzetta Salame & Parmigiano ($8)
*Pizzetta Margherita ($7)

I got the the glass of primitivo. I tried the chianti first, so I liked my glass a lot more. I'm into more full bodied cabs, so it was more my style. The liver pate was delish! My favorite food item we ordered. And there was a good amount of liver on each piece of bread. The margherita pizza was also tasty. I like a thinner crust, so this was definitely more my style. Not super thin as it retained a chew. Good amount of cheese and basil sauce too. I didn't try the grana padano as I'm more of a soft cheese girl. And everyone seemed to enjoy the salami pizza.

*Burrata: distefano burrata, balsamico, crostini ($10)
*2013 Madego, Cabernet Blend, La Capuccina, Veneto ($47)

After HH was over, we ordered a bottle of wine. I asked our server what she would recommend and she suggested the madego. I should have mentioned I had the primitivo beforehand as I found this bottle very light after drinking the HH glass. The burrata was good though. Nice and creamy. Definitely more up my alley in terms of cheese.

A fun neighborhood wine bar. Very tiny as it was packed when I got here. And there's only one restroom! Get here early if you want to guarantee yourself a seat!
author: Elena N.

description:
This is a great wine bar in the area. I really like how they feature all Italian wines. So many places here only have a very limited selection on Italian wine. 

Their happy hour selection of wine is great. $7 a glass and 3 different wines on the menu. I've only been once but hopefully they change up the menu a bit so they're a a rotating list of HH specials. 

Only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because of the pizzas. TBH I thought they were a bit bland. Didn't taste like authentic Italian pizza to me. The crostini and cheese were really good though! 

I'm definitely coming back to try more wines by the glass!
author: Michael P.

description:
InoVino is a gem in Cole Valley! Intimate and cozy Italian wine bar that has great happy hour options, cheese and charcuterie dishes, and a plethora of Italian wines.

My girlfriend and I came to this little spot on a whim on a busy Thursday night. We tried their Italian wine sampler tastings (Under the Tuscan Flight and Alpine Flight,) a cheese plate (Black Truffle Formaggio,) and ordered 2 separate pastas (Truffle Potato gnocchi and Spaghettoni Rummo.) 

The wines and dishes did not disappoint.
Service was friendly and attentive. 

I love this Italian wine bar tucked away on the corner of Cole, and would love to be back again.
author: Christie S.

description:
First timer (4/27/18) who met a friend here who lives in the area. I had a glass of both the reds on the Happy Hour menu (pic of the list included) and they were thoroughly delicious - very smooth and surprisingly light for reds. We also tried a few of the small plates - cheese/pears/honey/bread/almonds and a margarita pizza. Both plates were tasty and went well with our beverages. I'm not a wine pairing snob, I just know the food worked with our drinks. 

They open at 4pm and that's about the time we got there. Good thing, because it filled up pretty quickly. I suspect this is a regular occurrence because the wine is so good and reasonably priced, especially for the quality.  Only knock I had is that it's a bit tight inside. 

Definitely worth the visit.
author: Natalie S.

description: This is probably my favorite dining experience in the city! The wine and food were amazing! The service by Kristen and Brandon was prompt and friendly. I had the truffle cheese platter (which is incredible and a must have), the trout salad, artichoke salad, and pasta. Everything was delicious. I will definitely come back!
author: Andrea G.

description: Great daily happy hour! 4-6pm I believe. They have delish sparkling wine cocktails and tasty pizzettes. Can't wait to come back here.
author: Kelly G.

description: I don't see what the hype is about.. the food was decent, but the portions and taste did not live up to the price. We also waited for over half an hour for our food, and considering the size of the restaurant space and how many people were there, it didn't make any sense. Might be good for wine and hanging out, the atmosphere is definitely conducive to that. My one piece of advice is to not get the olive appetizer, you'll pay $5 for (what I'm almost positive was) jarred olives and toasted sandwich bread.
author: Jessi C.

description:
Met up with a friend here this evening as he had wanted to try this place.  From the outside, the place looks classy. We were greeted immediately upon entering and seated promptly. The interior itself is super small and a bit cramped. We were able to find a table in the corner. It was still happy hour so we were able to order some small plates as well as a few $7 glasses of wine. This is not your typical California wine bar. Most if not all wines are Italian. They have an extensive list but you should be familiar with Italian wines otherwise you might be lost. 

We each had a few glasses of wine and shared the crostini as well as a pizzette with salume (which I really enjoyed). 

My friend had a fly in his first glass of wine and then some cork in the glass of wine that replaced the one with the fly in it. Not a great first impression. But the service and food were good. 

In the end I felt that InoVino was a bit cramped and the wine list was a bit confusing. That along with the hiccups (no pun intended) with our first few glasses of wine, made me reach the conclusion that I will not return for a second visit.
author: Chris D.

description: Fantastic food, delicious wine, and very friendly staff. Truffle mushroom gnocchi was out of this world. Burratta pizzetta was delicious. Cole salad was an interesting&tasty mix of roasted veggies and greens. Great, reasonablly priced  wine selection of Italian varietals. Martine and Francesco took great care of our large group.
author: Stuart G.

description:
My friend and I had a great dinner here after a yoga class last night. At first entrance, the ambiance is great. Dim lighting and cozy seating make it a perfect option for date night or dinner with a friend or two. 

The wine selection was also good. Quite a decent list of wine by the glass. A lot of great Italian wines to choose from. You can also get tasting flights too if that's what you are into. 

For the food, we split a salad, burrata and beets, and a pasta dish. The pasta dish was absolutely the highlight of our meal. Fresh pasta that was cooked perfectly al dente. The sauce was delectable and had a slight spice to it too. 

Overall, I would highly recommend this place if you're nearby and looking for a low key but classy dinner/drinks out.
author: Grace A.

description: This is a hidden neighborhood gem that has become our favorite. We stop in every week for incredible treats from the tiny kitchen, wonderful wines and a welcoming, happy vibe. Last night we went for Happy Hour and enjoyed rose prosecos, crostini and pizette. Fantastic!
author: Hilary B.

description: Dog friendly outdoor seating with heat lamps so you and pooch can people watch. Great enoteca for wine and a nosh after a Mount Sutro hike. The flight of wines was fun to share with a cheese plate. Very friendly service. I like the continental European feel to the restaurant.
author: Carrie H.

description:
They have a great selection of wine and are very helpful in making suggestions according to your tastes.

We haven't eaten much here at except a cheese plate. It is a decent proportion size for the price. I would make the suggestion that they provide more bread for the cheese plate as there were 4 of us and we each only had one piece of bread. They did provide more when we asked, however!

The homemade almonds are excellent and portion size was very generous.

Looking forward to coming back soon!
author: Sara D.

description: Beautiful wine selection from both the regular and happy hour menus. Manager is from Italy so he knows his stuff. Seems like the "it spot" of the neighborhood. Will be back, especially on Tuesdays for no corkage!
author: Monica J.

description: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants of all time . The pasta sauce is made from scratch and it is authentically simple and perfect! Great selection of wines to pair with the great food . I would go there everyday if I could !
author: Rena V.

description: Amazing.  Atmosphere and service are cozy yet sophisticated and what they pull off in their small kitchen, phenomenal.  The test, we'll be back guaranteed.
author: Rachael L.

description: We love coming to this lovely neighborhood spot for some great Italian wine and small bites. It has warm family-like atmosphere with the gracious host/owner. Food is always fresh and flavorful. The wine bar is a bit on a small side with limited seating, but we try to arrive before 5 pm on Saturdays before it starts getting busy.
author: EG P.

description: One of my favorite places for a night out in the city. The food, wine and service are always stellar. A hidden gem!
author: Brooke R.

description:
Wish this place existed when I lived in the 'hood. Fabulous happy hour!

Delicious, well-priced food and wine. Friendly, personable service. Comfy, warm ambiance in a cozy space. 

Highly recommended!
author: Kim C.

description: If there were six stars for the service, I would give it! Wonderful evening. Until next time :)
author: Andreas W.

description: What a find! I can't believe this place has been here for many years already and today was the first time we discovered it. Fantastic lines great food friendly service. We will definitely be back, frequently.
author: Silly H.

description: Lovely establishment! The wines they suggested were "really good" according to my fancy French friend "from Paris." We had four different glasses of red, and we enjoyed every single one. They even let you order half glasses for pretty much half the price which lets you sample twice as many wines! The charcuterie plate was fantastic as was the burrata pizza. Honestly, I just love this place and I will definitely be back!
author: Charles L.

description: Fantastic wine list, great cheese, this is my spot after enjoying a San Francisco Delta's game to unwind and bask in soccer glory over a glass of Barolo and their world class charcuterie plate. We only order the charcuterie if the Deltas win, to encourage us to cheer extremely passionately during the game.
author: Tasha D.

description: Such a great little spot! The staff is very professional and always willing to provide suggestions for wine (I don't know much about Italian wines). I love their food options too. It's a perfect spot to catch up with a friend or go on a date. It's small though so expect a wait if you go at a peak time.
author: Allie Q.

description:
Best restaurant in all of cole valley. Easily. Food is great and handmade. Drinks are good and portions are appropriate. 

It is a little intimate, which isn't ideal bc u really bump in to the person next to u, but it is a great cozy spot
author: Dan K.

description:
Cozy Cole Valley spot with a long wine list and an open kitchen. The risotto, gnocchi and persimmon salad were all delicious. Their mains all seem to be a quite heavy on cheese which can be a little much, however the quality of the cheese is good. At one point, we saw the chef drop a large, almost-new block of cheese while grating it and he promptly tossed it into the trash and picked out a new one. I can't imagine too many places have that level of integrity.

I recommend InoVino whole-heartedly as a dinner spot - they are open late.
author: Vikram N.

description:
I'm so happy to have gone here the day I was leaving SF. It was delicious and walking distance of where I was staying at. It is right of the N-Judah on Carl and Cole. 

It's super quaint and I love the music being played. That jazz atmosphere makes enjoying my wine even better. I happened to have come here during happy hour and oh boy was I not disappointed. The food was light, but filling and a great size to share with another person. Also got the Formaggi Pecorino Moliterno al Tartufo cause boyfriend was a total black truffle sucker. It was totally bomb as you eat the bread, cheese, Tuscan honey and apple slice together, yes I said with apple slice. This totally blew my taste buds and mind and I'm sure we all want that with food. 

You can look at the pictures I posted to get a visual idea of what I ate. Enjoy!
author: Corie L.

description: I am greatly impressed. I walked by this restaurant many times and it wasn't until my neighbor suggested we dine there that I knew what I was missing. Exquisite food and great service. It was a pleasure dining there. If you go, don't miss trying the gnocchi with mushrooms, it was incredible. I can't wait to have an excuse to go back!
author: Sari S.

description:
Cozy wine bar with knowledgeable staff and delicious eats. The charcuterie plate was one of the best I've ever had. Tell the server your taste and price range and he will choose an appropriate bottle. I probably wouldn't get the pizzette again since the dough was kind of bland. But I'm kind of spoiled coming out of Brooklyn. 

Very happy I stumbled upon this place. 

$100 before tip for bottle of wine, charcuterie and pizzette
author: Jason F.

description:
Friday night no reservations and promptly seated in a cozy corner for two.

More vino +'s:
+ walked right in and got a table. great hosting.
+ cozy and dim lighting. tables spaced not very far apart so be prepared to overhear some conversation.
+ margherita pizza had great seasonings on a thin soft crust.
+ potato gnocchi in truffle oil were pillowy balls of bliss.   i don't think sharing will work for me next time.
+ flight of wines was a tasty wine to spend the night.
+ awesome service.

Check please -'s:
- nothing to note.

Plan to return. Love that we could just walk in on a Friday evening and get seated.
author: Yiven C.

description: Amazing hidden gem! The space is cozy and intimate. Loved the jazz and overall ambiance. Our server was friendly and attentive. The gnocchi is super filling, rich and full of flavor. The margherita pizza is light but worth it. Don't forget the kale salad! Would totally recommend for a date or treat
author: Sonya S.

description:
Had a wonderful meal with our 8-year old son. The food was very good. We had a cheese plate, a few appetizers,  and a main dish with a couple glasses of wine. 

The staff was friendly and treated my son as a guest, not the child of the guests. They brought him a wine glass for his Pellegrino.  

The atmosphere was lively. It was loud, but it is an Italian restaurant. We will definitely return.
author: Adam L.

description: Wow wow Wow.  My new favorite Italian spot.  Great ambiance, amazing food, huge and reasonably priced wine list.  And the tiramisu is fuggedaboutit!
author: A T.

description: Love this neighborhood gem!  They've always been accommodating with the seating arrangements outside.  The food and the wine are too notch!  We didn't get it but the gnocchi looked and smelled beyond amazing!!
author: Brye L.

description:
My wife and I have eaten and drank here for a few years now and finally decided to get our review written up. 

Claudio and his team have exceeded our expectations repeatedly.  This is one of the top wine bars in the bay area and the country.  Great drink expertly selected and guided, good and thoughtful food, reasonable prices, neighborhood vibe, and friendly staff. We've never left disappointed. 

Well done and highly recommended. !
author: Stephen R.

description:
There are a few reasons why I might not have been impressed with InoVino at all. First of all, my friend and visited an hour before their closed, so the staff members were clearly in a bit of a frenzy. Second, we didn't order dinner because we only came here for desserts and wine. Maybe we just did not experience how amazing the food is.

With that said, the desserts and wine were not impressive. Well... I don't know much about wine, so I'll skip that part. We shared the Nebbiolo Flights ($20) but it was alright. I wouldn't get it again but I would like to try some of the other flights.

We ordered two desserts. The Chocolate Cake with Hazelnuts ($7) was good. Super dense so definitely pair it with some sort of dessert wine. The Lemon Ricotta Mousse with Blood Orange and Pistachios ($7) was a no-go. I would not order this again or recommend it. Neither dessert was impressive for the amount of reviews this place has (nor was the service) so I'm guessing we just missed out on what makes InoVino so special.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Cozy Neighborhood Place. reat to meet up with friends  there. Always enjoy the experience, highly recommend
author: Tony T.

description: I went here with my son since it was close to the hotel. I absolutely loved the food and ambience. We ordered the salami plate, pizza and the truffle pasta. I had a flight of Tuscan reds. The wine was delicious. I'm still thinking about my pasta and my son's dessert days later. The staff were exceedingly friendly as well.
author: Suzanne P.

description: Wonderful ambience, fabulous service and delicious bites and meals! The beet risotto  was amazing! And oh yes!!! The wine was perfect.
author: Halina Y.

description:
The food in general was good/ok, nothing too spectacular. We ordered the margherita pizza (thin and crunchy), fava with rapini, farrotto, and 2 glasses of wine which came out to $61 plus tip

Why the 3 stars??
- service was slow and lacking for a place that's been open for 1 year
- LOUD. So loud, I couldn't hear myself talk. So loud, we ate and said almost nothing to one another. So loud, we rushed through the meal to get ice cream down the block instead. I got so tired of yelling across the table and asking "what?!!" "Huh?!!"

If it wasn't for the loudness on a rainy Monday night, id give them 4 stars easily. 

Will I come back? No.

The pizza  was my favorite amongst the 3 dishes ...
author: Angelica C.

description: Great spot for wine, cheese and charcuterie!  Good selection, generous portions and pours, and cozy environment.
author: Mallika M.

description: Came recommended by a real Italian. I wish they served a legit aperitivo buffet like in Italy. However, place is super quaint, warm and cozy (perfect for a cool evening) and has a great selection. Pizzas and meats were both awesome! Wine was delicious.
author: Andrew K.

description: Delicious. Cannot be beaten for the price and the friendliness of the staff. Came here with a friend who was from Italy and confirmed everything is authentic and done right. I can't wait to come back and try everything!
author: Neil H.

description:
I'm ashamed to say that I've lived 2 blocks from this place and never knew about this decadent food experience in my backyard. 

Musings from Sinatra and Gershwin complemented the $6 happy hour (4-6pm) Savoie white wine conversation with my girlfriend. I highly recommend the Margherita as it is a combination of thin, perfectly baked crust and ratio of cheese/bite. The Bruschetta (Cannellini Bean Purree) was larger than expected - always a good thing. The highlight of the meal was the cheese plate. I'm a sucker for black truffle, but the Formaggi Pecorino Moliterno al Tartufo took me outta sight. Put the almond bread, cheese (slightly sharp with a full body taste), Tuscan honey, and apple slice together and you'll see what I'm talking about!
author: Damond N.

description:
A fan. Wonderful, warm atmosphere, excellent little happy hour menu, delicious food and drink, and the service couldn't be better. 

We stopped in for a bite and a drink, and left very pleased after a generous half-glass pour of brut rosé, a happy hour rosso spritzer and a Peroni, a pizzetta, and spaghettoni all'amatriciana.
author: Heather F.

description:
InoVino, what can I say? I love wine and I love the Haight area and I love it here. It is such a quaint, romantic place for good conversation and good wine. The serving staff is so friendly and so open to help you decide which wines are more for you. I went for happy hour and got some nice wines and bruschetta for a great price!

highly recommend this place to anyone in the area :)
author: Bori B.

description: We stopped here because we were early for a Padrecito reservation.  Great Italian wine list.  We ordered the pate and instead of the tablespoon of liver heaven you usually get, we wound up with an entree-sized portion of pate, baguette, herbs, flower petals, etc, etc, etc.  Generous portions, generous pours, great service, great atmosphere.
author: Kevin S.

description:
I don't drink at all so you know that if I am a regular at a wine bar it has to have REALLY good food.
My husband and I try to come here weekly.  If is so delicious.   The burrata is stellar, as is the fava bean soup.  We usually also get one of their pizzas. Perfect place for a date night.
Martins is a great waitress!
author: D D.

description:
Came here for a late meal, since few other places were open, and this place was rated well. They have very few meal options, all over-priced, and the pizettes we ended up getting were terrible. My partner's pizette was actually disgusting. Also, it didn't taste like they used pizza dough for the crust; it was more like a ready made cracker, which was just weird. And yes, I do love good homemade thin crust pizzas ... Enough to know this wasn't one.

The appetizer we got (Californian caprese) was pretty good, so +2 stars for that. The service was fine. I could believe that this would be a fine place for drinks, but it's an incredibly terrible place for dinner. 

I will not be back.
author: M. K.

description: Every aspect of our evening at InoVino was spectacular. The roasted squash, cauliflower puree, pomegranate, brown butter, crispy breadcrumbs, & sage was amazing. Truffle potatoes gnocchi with porcini was delightful. Thanks to the waitress who recommended the 2009 Gattinara from Anzivino - a really lovely rendering of Nebbiolo. Claudio plays his stellar jazz mix in the dining room, which makes you want order more wine so you can linger a bit longer in the all-enveloping coziness.
author: Jon W.

description: The happy hour from 4-6 is one of the best experiences in the city. The attention to the fresh ingredients, wine selection and stylish service are authentically Italian. You could close your eyes and imagine that the N is really the Arno and you're transported to Florence year-round.
author: warren h.

description:
What a sweet, romantic, casual, neighborhood spot. We arrived just before 6:30pm on a Friday night, we were seated immediately, we got the last table (whoop!). They only take reservations for 5 or more, and the wait varied throughout the night : at times there were two groups waiting around to be seated and at other moments there would be an empty table or two. 

We decided to try the sparkling + red wine flight, over-all, they were ok, some were stellar as a food pairing none of them were that fantastic as a stand-alone. Next time we will probably order a bottle OR do a tasting flight and just have a cheese plate. 

The food was solid. Started with the kale, carrot and farro salad, it was good not particularly complicated or mesmerizing, but good. The burrata, mozzarella, peas and asparagus salad rocked!! The burrata + peas were sooooo good!!! Next up, Margherita  pizza. Seriously, I mean seriously, one of the best pizzas of my life. I have had a lot of pizza people. This was soooo good. Particularly if you are a thin crust fan, my oh my.

Last: Cannoli + an awesome glass of 2010 Malvasia delle Lipari, Vulcano, Lantieri (first time that I ever had it and it will not be my last). I would have preferred a sweeter cannoli however the drink pair was so darn lovely, it actually turned our slightly boring dessert into something that tasted more like a sumptuous donut. 

Great evening. With all of that food, wine etc... we were out the door for a little over $100 before tip. Share a wine flight or a bottle, share a salad and pizza and you'd be out the door at around $60 ish.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Good ambience, but on the louder side. Great food (delicious risotto and pizza!) and great wine.
author: Ingrid C.

description: Stumbled onto this gem while visiting a friend. Atmosphere was wonderful giving you a transported feeling to any number of spots in Europe (whilst Italian) it had a feel of Cafe Resto in Paris. The wines were wonderful - yes, but the food was incredible. The gnocchi was one of the finest dishes I've had anywhere. The risotto and the spaghetti were amazing as well. Having had a wonderful meal we opted for some dessert and, it too did not disappoint. We will be returning again and again. Do not pass by his place by without stopping in, you won't be sorry.
author: Steve R.

description:
This is an intimate Italian restaurant in Cole Valley. I've been twice and have had 2 wonderful experiences. Even with a tiny, busy restaurant they've managed to seat my parties quickly and the service has been fast. 

I recommend going on a date or small group with intent to share dishes. 
To start- get one of the meat plates- it's a generous heap of thinly sliced meats served with sliced, olive oil dressed bread.
Pizza- Rapini, Sausage & Burrata flatbread 
Salads- the Cole and Italian Riviera salads are both great
Entree- the Risotto alla Modenese

They also have a large wine list. I will definitely be back!
author: Caroline L.

description: Cozy little spot tucked away in Cole Valley, right off the N-Judah line. Great apertivo hour and cute setting. Great for meeting a couple of friends after work or for date night!
author: Ashley M.

description: Enjoyed the prosciutto pizza and mushroom gnocchi. Good portion size. It's handy that they sell half-glasses of wine!
author: Anjolie C.

description: This is based on having happy hour drinks outside. The wine really wasn't the best & the service was slow, made worse by having to ask for water three times (it never arrived). Maybe we were overlooked because we weren't "high rollers", but we're pretty new to the area & it has put us off giving them any repeat business.
author: Fi M.

description:
I misunderstood the point of this place and thought it was a full Italian place but it isn't.  That doesn't bring down my score.  I don't drink so I can't comment on the wine (ironic I know) but I can say the pizza is amazing. San Daniele with parmigiana, arugula and prosciutto on a delicate thin crust... But it is the stracchino cheese that was killer.  I also had the bruschetta as well and it was OK but the toppings were a bit too heavy and unique.  But still great quality.  I would come back for the pizza and I am not a pizza guy by choice.  
Very attentive service as well!
author: El Jefe J.

description:
My favourite italian aperitivo place in SF.
It's a great location to meet friends after work. Get one of their amazing wines, get one of their delicious small plates, and you evening will start with the right vibe.
My suggestion is to go in a group, order several piatti to share, so you can get a taste of their selection of cheeses, salumi and pizzas.
Another point in their favor is that the owners are real italians, so you can taste some authentic recipes, that are different from the usual italian-american selection.
author: Amira T.

description:
While things run slow in terms with of service, as well as being a bit pricey, it's great.

The hostess, Martine, was a doll; knew the food well and was very courteous.

I LOVED their moscato, so sweet and light. 

As for food, I liked how it was light, but filling. Their pizzas are round circles of fresh, cheesy, meaty goodness. The appetizers were a bruschetta trio, one with anchovies, one with beans I believe, and another with pureed sausage. The sausage was my favorite. 

Dessert was a ricotta lemon moose with blood orange and flourless chocolate cake. The moose was light and nice but could have used more acidity. And the cake wasn't the BEST, but it was good. My companion got am espresso, which she liked, and it had a little yummy pistachio biscotti on the side.

It's a cute little hole in the wall restaurant. Go straight for their wine and pizza.
author: Bahar A.

description:
The food is out of this world, the selection of wines is just phenomenal, dessert... How can you go wrong? Claudio is just wonderful and all the people working at Inovino make you reminiscence of Italy. 
Overall, at Inovino, the food and the service and Francesco are fantastic!! Thank you.
author: Rebeca R.

description: After a trip to InoVino My Chinese wife is in love Italian cuisine -- except if i take her anywhere else, it falls flat. Nothing holds a candle to inovino's Gnocchi -- gummy, chewy, crispy and even a crunch. They taste like they have sticky rice in them.  Topped with just a couple of crispy fried (marjoram?) herb leaves. Or their simple Burrata. Even the olives are incredible. And isn't that the true test of a great restaurant? Excellent food executed simply. More complex food executed excellently.
author: Alex M.

description: I love this little neighborhood gem!! I got the gnocchi and it was so BOMB! Great wine selection and fun outdoor seating.
author: Shannon L.

description: Went here for Valentine's day and it was very romantic. The ambience is nice, it's a small restaurant in the cute Cole Valley neighborhood. You can sit outside under heat lamps or inside. The food is awesome and there is a large wine selection. Surprisingly affordable considering the "fancy" atmosphere.
author: Gina T.

description: Small, highly curated Italian wine bar with awesome food. Go. Its a neighborhood gem.
author: Sunil P.

description: Food is fantastic. If you're an Italian food fanatic, you should try this place.  Menu is short but you can't find a bad dish.  The meat plate is amazing. The pizzette is amazing. Wine selection? Broken record, amazing!  Will definitely be coming back...frequently
author: Christopher C.

description: Excellent staff helped us to order from large wine selection. Our tapas were fresh unique preparations. We especially liked the salads as well as the thin crust spec pizza. Has a wonderful Europe in Cole valley feel. In good weather the outside seating is available as space inside is limited but still a very intimate space.
author: Helen M.

description: A terrific place for happy hour with a glass of wine and a cheese or salumi plate or a pizzeria.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
We came here many times over the years when this space hosted Hama-ko, a quirky Japanese place operated by an older couple (and with its own quirky reputation.)

Now that Inovino has been open a while we decided to try it on my birthday, thinking that we would just go for a spritz and a snack of some kind.

We tried the (quite non-traditional) spritz and while I liked it fine, my partner, who is Italian, was less than thrilled. But while we were eating the absolutely delicious burrata and buffalo mozzarella antipasto we scanned the menu further and were amazed by the unique wine list and so decided to make a dinner of it. We were not disappointed.

We went on to try the mortadella mousse, which was phenomenal and the finocchiona pizzeta which was quite good though I prefer my crust either crispier and more cracker-like, or chewier and more bread-like...

All washed down by some truly excellent, and not at all common wines, white in this case; we had the Erbaluce (a grassy white from Piemonte), and the Ischia Bianco from near Naples, a startlingly fresh white redolent of the sea, with, what is that? A note of salt? Wonderful.

We finished with the tiny northern-style cannoli accompanied by a lovely Malvasia from the Aolian Islands just north of Sicily. Perfect.

We discovered that the owner, Claudio, has a very interesting background in restaurants and as a sommelier and the solid food and incredibly interesting wine list, shows it. You can find the wines of Claudio's native Tuscany on any wine list in the City, but his range of fine northern and true southern wines, including many by the glass, is worth the visit all on its own....
author: Ken K.

description: Small and intimate polished Italian faire. Very nice Italian wines by the glass. Come early for the specials.
author: Marty T.

description:
I always forget they are closed on Sunday! Definitely wish they picked Monday to take off; it seems like I'm always trying to bring people on Sunday.

In any case, I've always had a great experience here and think their staff is great (friendly, knowledgeable, fast), the wine is fantastic, and their food is great.
author: Nate R.

description:
Thank God I don't still live in Cole Valley because if I did, I'd be spending all my time here. 

I came here last night, and I was a little skeptical at first... It may have been mostly the fault of this one table close to us that had not only someone with a loud/shrill/annoying laugh but also another person who had the grossest-sounding cough you've ever heard in your life. She should maybe have been in a hospital.

On top of that, I was there with my favorite person in the world, who also happens to indulge my judgyness maybe a little too much, so you could say it was impossible for InoVino to get off on the right foot given these circumstances. I had my "I think I'm a professional critic" hat on.

Once I got off my high horse, I realized just how lovely the place was. It was a quiet Monday night, and we sat outside because it was amazingly nice out. We didn't have a problem with slow service (how fast do these people drink their wine?), and, in fact, I should mention that our waitress, Sally, was just wonderful all around. We got a white flight and a red flight, and Sally a lot of information about each wine we drank.... But naturally that went in one ear and out the other. They were all delicious, though.

The food was pretty good, but nothing to write home about. Pretty standard Italian appetizer-type options. Whoever says the prices are high is crazy.... All the food is right around $10, and you can get flights of wine for $15-$20. Their happy hour also looks great/affordable.

ON TOP OF ALL OF THAT... when aforementioned favorite person fell backwards in his chair and broke a plate in the process, they were speedy to clean it up and very forgiving, all while laughing about it with us.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Live in the neighborhood and have been meaning to try this place since it opened.   My other half and I walked down around 7:30'sh on a saturday night and were seated at the high table 4 top - the tables were all full as was the small bar.  We ordered a delicious fennel salad, hamachi crudo (but they didn't actually have hamachi so it was a substitute), the burratta appetizer and 2 pizzas.  One anchovie and the other w/squash.  Everything was delicious, we could have done without the burratta since we got the pizzas, we ended up taking two slices home.

this is a great neighborhood addition.  The staff were lovely and I didn't notice slow service, on the contrary, they seemed very attentive.  It was a perfect spur of the moment date night destination. 

btw not a big wine drinker, so I asked for a glass of their driest white, and it did not disappoint.  My hubby did the red wine flight and was pleased by all three.
author: Mrs. S.

description:
Had dinner here for the first time recently, and we were very happy with it. It actually wasn't our first choice because we had a very active toddler in tow, but everything else was either closed or packed, so we decided to give it a try. Despite not being a toddler kind of place, the staff was super friendly and accommodating. Service was a real high point the entire evening.
Not surprisingly, the wines were fantastic. However, we were also very happy with the food. We tried several of the pizzas, and they were all quite tasty. Just know that they're fairly light, so a pizza alone probably isn't the way to go if you're starving.
author: Pat M.

description: I loved this place!!! Its very small, which gave it a great cozy vibe that I liked. My friend and I met here for drinks and dinner after work, and we were able to get a seat without a reservation. There was a very long wine list, as well as really wide range of cheeses.  As lovers of both cheese and wine, but have no idea what we are doing, our waiter was kind enough to recommend his favorite wine, which was excellent. He also then assisted us with getting a cheese plate that went well with our order. We also were given extra bread to eat our cheese, which was very kind of them! We are definitely coming back!
author: Anne L.

description: A nice, intimate place to eat, however it is extremely noisy. Amtrak passes by every few minutes. The food is excellent quality at reasonable prices. Menu is a bit small & limited, not very many non-alcoholic beverages. Service is excellent. I would come back here again but I'd prefer to come during off peak hours when there were not so many people making so much noise.
author: Ismail M.

description: What a great discovery. This small beautifully decorated spot is on my new favorites list! Perfect sharing menu and an extensive list of excellent cheeses and wines. The crudos are wonderful as was most everything else I tried. Warm welcoming owner and staff. Try it. You will like it.
author: Carolyn L.

description:
Need a local, non-fancy, inexpensive wine bar that has a happy hour and better, more diverse selection of wines by the glass. This place is too expensive for what you get. Food is over-priced. I don't see it surviving long.

Very nice wait staff and pleasant environment. 

My wife and I were never fans of Perbacco either, so it makes sense that we don't like Ino.
author: T L.

description:
Delizioso, So 'as is done in Italian wineries, wine and food  , great selection of cheese and so much more. Fantastic hospitality.
That's the way to do it.
author: Maico C.

description: Love this place! Wine and food are amazing and the service is great too. The owner is an expert sommelier and he's around most nights, so take the time to chat with him and get a good wine recommendation.
author: Juan G.

description:
this place is always a treat to have wine and small tasty bits  
The staff is great and the place is warm and cozy. Much charm goes into the 
food and place. Awesome wine selection.
This a the best craving place to go again and agin!!!
author: Der Maibaum L.

description:
We stopped by here for a lunch during our San Francisco sightseeing tour. We had a couple of cocktails and some beers. 

The place itself is a quiet cozy small restaurant with a very service minded and friendly staff. We ordered one pizza each, and it was very good. Though the place is a little pricy for the amount of food you get.
author: Stian J.

description: Love this place. Went there with a few friends. We were unfamiliar with Italian reds, so one of the servers asked us questions on our wine preferences. He also let us have tastes of the ones he was recommending. After a few tastes, we got a delicious bottle.  In terms of food, we ordered the selection of meats, and cheeses; which was super good. Of important note, the sever recommended certain cheeses based on the wine we ordered, and he was spot-on - the cheese he selected went very well with the wine. Will def. be back!
author: SinGlu V.

description: Every time I walk into this place, I feel like I'm in Italy. Great wine list, welcoming and knowledgeable staff, cozy atmosphere, wonderful small plates that they turn out in a tiny kitchen. After a few visits, Claudio and the servers know exactly which wine I will like best, which is always different from the one they know my husband will like best. This is the kind of neighborhood place you dream of, that doesn't exist outside of Italy except at Inovino. I rarely see any reason to go anywhere else. An unpretentious gem.
author: Laura F.

description: Great for both wine AND food. Happy hour is the key to not breaking the bank. Tiny little place so get there early or expect a wait.
author: Chloe B.

description: I was so disappointed . Especially with all the reviews . We got there at 8 and didn't get service until 8:40. We kept waiting for someone to take our order but no luck finally a woman gets there and takes our order our wind comes out fast but then the dreaded wait for our cheese platter ruined the experience . Finally it comes out with the man handing the platter over the kitchen counter without ever seeing the woman again. I did see facial hair on our cheese platter but chose to not to say anything as I don't like to deal with the wait as this has happened at other restaurants before.  I wanted two more glasses of wine and to order olives but since no one came we didn't want to risk the chance of having to wait as we had reservations at another restaurant . Go to inner fog great wine , great food , great service . I won't be coming here sadly .
author: Andy L.

description:
I've been several times now, with service the first time (opening week) being a bit scattered (as one might expect initially) but they've since smoothed things out and service was much better on subsequent visits.

(Really if I could I'd give them 4.5 stars--minus half for having the tables so close each other but deducting a full star for that doesn't seem right. They're doing what they can with a small space).

Pros
-Unique and well-curated wine list (assuming you're into mostly Italian wines, especially volcanic and alpine regions), all selected by a knowledgeable and friendly owner. 
-Small and larger pours available, meaning you can taste a little of many varieties, or, if you're a lightweight like me, get an amount that's just right without drinking too much or wasting any because you still need to get home/work the next day.
-Food options are not overwhelming--just enough variety, and all delicious--an excellent selection of Italian classics (burrata, prosciutto, etc) for reasonable prices.
-Super easy access from N Judah (parking difficult otherwise).

Cons
-Really small space--can result in a wait to get a table or seat if it's busy. (But they've done a lot within those space constraints...)
-Tables are, like so many other SF restaurants, a bit close for my taste. 

So far, so good. Curious to see what the future brings.
author: Mike Y.

description: Service has gotten much better and it's now one of my favorite wine bars in the city.  They also have a great happy hour.
author: Tom F.

description: Had dinner off the happy hour menu, so we paid a very modest price for high quality pizza and salad. Plus our waiter (maybe the owner?) was precious and helpful.
author: Siobhan B.

description:
I am soooo happy to have this place in our neighborhood! 
Fabulous small plates, innovative wine selection.
Great service, nice atmosphere!
Ate here twice, tried different dishes. 
Haven't had better outside of Italy.
author: Ken M.

description: I am SO glad this place has come to Cole Valley.  It is super cute and has a lovely selection of wines and appetizers.  I love that they have the nice out door tables and it will be come a regular spot for me.
author: Amy P.

description: Finally a good wine bar in Cole Valley! Nice Northern Italian wine list, good cheeses (mostly local) and bigger bites designed to go with the wines. The owner Claudio is a gracious host.  The place is really small and can get loud but still has a great atmosphere.  A good place to take a date, or hang out with friends.
author: Finn T.

description: This place is so good I almost want to keep it a secret. The happy hour is one of the best deals around. And the staff is great--friendly and informative.
author: Harlin K.

description: Welcome to the neighborhood. We enjoyed delicious wine, and the cheese looked tempting. Selection is predominantly Italian. Place was filled by 7. Looking forward to returning!
author: Susan J.

description: Excellent place with wonderful owner and staff. It's quaint and cozy with a great selection of wines & cheese. The small plates are delectable as well. The atmosphere is perfect for a date or ladies night to catch up. Claudio, the owner, knows well about food and wine and is an absolute delight. A great neighborhood gem, wish it was near me, but great to visit if you're in the area. Highly recommend doing the Appertivo Hour from 3-6pm (it's on Saturdays too!). My fave to start is the Aperol Spritzer (takes me back to Italy), I love the prosciutto de Parma, and the mushroom farro dish.
author: Ritu M.

description:
the tasty bites? delicious- we had a pizza with salame and the delica squash salad.
the drinks? lovely- we had a lambrusco that was the right level of sweet (hardly).
the noise level? LOUD, but not too unbearable.

the service? a little slow, but the servers were nice.

I'd definitely suggest to a friend- check it out for yourself.
author: Andy S.

description:
Had a great time with my parents, boyfriend and brother
The cheese plate was amazing
Both the salami and prosciutto plates were amazing
Their pizzas were awesome!
and the had a great Italian wine collection and the ones we had were great
Had a great time!!!
We had a chance to sit in front of the cheese cutters/ plate makers while we waited for a table and it was great looking at all the ingredients! Yumm!
Great for a date, cozy, good atmosphere
Great place for wine tasting!
author: Flo P.

description: I just came here last night for the first time. Since I get off the N Muni at Carl & Cole every day, I'm not sure how I've never noticed this place. It's tucked right next to Crepes on Cole and is quite small and cozy. We ordered a couple of glasses of wine and one of their pizettes. My sangiovese was decent and so was the pizza (not spectacular but no complaints - the spicy peppers were a nice touch). The prices are pretty true to other wine bars around the city, the cheapest glass of wine is $9 and you can get up to $16 or so. Since it's close to home I'll probably be back at some point!
author: Lindsey B.

description:
If you're looking for an unforgettable experience of matching wine with great antipasti, salumi and hard-to-find Italian cheeses, look no further. 

InoVino is true to its roots of delivering an excellent Italian Enoteca experience with focus on wines that grow on volcanic soil and a perfectly-lit ambiance that takes you away like a great restaurant experience should. 

Claudio Villani, the owner, is a certified Italian sommelier. He has managed great wine programs at restaurants in Florence and in San Francisco (Incanto, Quince) and he has finally created his brain child at InoVino, by offering a rare combination of artisanal food and wines, all at very reasonable prices.

What we had the night we visited was an incredible bottle of Piedirosso (a grape variety from the Campania region of Italy that is normally of average quality but at the hands of the right producer can deliver a very unique smoky/earthy nose and deep red cherry flavors) which matched perfectly with our food: 

- a tepid soup of baked tomatoes (the prized Corbara tomatoes from Calabria) topped with melt-in-your mouth fresh Burrata cheese and topped with a basil puree - amazingly simple and wonderfully delicious.

- Mozzarella di Bufala (COP from Campania) topped with anchovy and sprinkle of olive oil and basil puree - the flavors melded into a perfect combination specially when you washed it down with the Piedirosso

- A triplet of Italian prosciutto (from Parma, San Daniele, and the slightly smoky Speck from the Alps of Italy in Alto Adige) - comparing the 3 different prosciutto is a really cool way of discovering the range of flavors that Italian prosciutto can deliver.

- The best cheese plate that I've ever had (three cheeses ranging from a mild creamy semi-hard cheese called Salva Cremasco from Lombardia; to a creamy blue cheese from Piemonte called Blu del Moncenisio which went perfectly with the walnut bread it was served with; and last but not least, the best truffle pecorino that I've ever had - in Italy or here - called Pecorino Moliterno al Tartufo).

We ended the meal with a dessert of fresh ricotta cheese infused with chestnut honey and topped with shavings of excellent dark chocolate paired perfectly with a glass of Vin Santo.

It's rare to find a place in SF that focuses on great ingredients and simplicity in a way that exceeds your expectations. This place really reminded us of great little finds in Italy that effortlessly serve meals that you remember for a lifetime...so good that you almost don't want to share them...and this time in our own city. Don't miss this gem of a place!
author: A. R.

description: I know many wine bars in SF and this is the place you need to discover.  Tucked away in cute Cole Valley, this spot is a friendly and cozy treat. Perfect for a date or meet-up with friends. The wines are constantly changing with the seasons, and the food selections (all house made) are designed to compliment.  Among the most knowledgeable wine people in the world, Claudio focuses on mountain/alpine varietals from Italy and the border regions. Plus, most wines are available by the half-bottle, so you're not limited to the glass-list. I had a half-bottle of the Friulano with the Alpina pizza ($9 very reasonable) and Ricotta-filled cannoli. Yumm!!
author: Angelo Q.

description:
Came in on a Friday night with a "fellow working mom" aka, best friend...  and enjoyed ourselves tremendously. 
Service great. Food fun. Perfect evening.

A great place for a date., either with a friend, a spouse, or someone new. One feels young and hip, regardless of age.Loved the Barbara. Loved Stephanie.

Come here and have fun.
author: Katrina R.

description: Wonderfully quaint neighborhood wine bar! Claudio and his staff are accommodating, knowledgeable and super friendly. We had 18 friends there for my birthday and Claudio went out of his way to make it extra special. He was willing to go as relaxed of fancy as we wished and offered great prices. Definitely recommend this place to all my friends who love Italian wine and tasty bites!
author: Hayley D.

description:
Terrible service on Sat 11/16. There was a very nice guy who we saw a few times, but our waitress was unpleasant and seemed annoyed to have us there. Couldn't get out fast enough.

Good was fine and wine selection seemed good, but would not return on account of the awful service.
author: Michael S.

description: B&B salad is everything. This place has such a great ambiance. Authentic and intimate, without the overpriced menu.
author: Andrew W.

description: Met a friend here that I had not seen in years so we could catch up over a glass of wine (or 2 or 3). This is just a really quaint and cool Cole Valley hangout. It's quiet, dimly lit, and very cozy. Turned out to be the perfect place to dig into the past, present and future while indulging in a little vino. Most of the wines I saw on the menu were European, I don't think I saw any Californian wines. This is neither good or bad. I first ordered a glass of Barosa and followed that with a glass of Barbera. Both wines were quite enjoyable. To me that says something. I think this little wine bar knows their stuff. To accompany our wine we ordered both a cheese plate and a prosciutto plate. Both were fantastic selections of cheese and meats. I liked that they brought different breads for each and an ample amount of bread, meaning I didn't run out and have a need to ask for more. The service was also excellent. The waitress was very pleasant and came over several times to ask if things were ok, if we wanted anything more and even informed us when the kitchen would be closing in case we wanted to slip in a last minute order. The one draw back is maybe their hours. By 10:30 on a Saturday evening they were closing down. To be fair they were not busy but I saw a women come in and she was turned away. I'd like to see them stay open a bit later on weekends, I think there's a late night crowd that would love a little hang out like this. Bottom line, great place to chill, perfect place for a semi-casual date, looking forward to returning and will definitely recommend to others.
author: Eric C.

description: Small, cozy place with good food. I came here for happy hour and we ordered olives and bruschetta with a glass of red wine each. The bruschetta, with a white bean spread on top, is glorious. It is rich and the bread is grilled expertly. The bean spread is piled high on the perfectly crusty yet soft on the inside bread and coated w olive oil. I want to come back here for a full meal and try their other wines.
author: D K.

description: Great selection of wines and decent Happy Hour deals. However, the food is overpriced and portions are small. Also, it can get very loud and warm inside, since the space is so small. Make sure to arrive early, it gets packed quickly. They do have a few tables out in front, but are apparently not allowed to serve alcohol outside, so that you have to get your wine through the windows. Nice neighborhood spot.
author: Laura D.

description: Stopped in for a quick dinner after work by myself and was extremely welcomed. The owner waited on me and did not waiver in his kindness when I started asking about gluten free choices. He reassured my choice of the Risotto with a Rose was a good choice. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience while listening to chill lounge and very friendly service including the chef Juan coming to say hello. I finished with the lemon mouse and a great desert wine paring suggestion which I have to say you can't have one without the other. Will definitely be back to enjoy.
author: K Q.

description: I don't easily give out five stars, but this little place earned each one of them.  We arrived a little later than the rest of our party and they were happy to rearrange their tables to accomodate us.  The wine we had was delicious, the snacks were out of this world, and the service was great.  I cannot remember which wines we had, but they were some lighter reds that were super drinkable.  We got some salads, bruschettas, and the meat trio of some sort.  It had speck on it!  I don't know of any other restaurants that have speck on their menu.  We were there on a Thursday night from about 5-7 and found it to be not busy at all, lucky us!!
author: Felicia M.

description: I really enjoyed the vibe at InoVino. The space is small, but warm and comfortable and the service was amazing. I got great recommendations and felt very cared for by the owner and the waitstaff. I didn't like the Brussels Sprouts and they took them off the bill. But the other food and the wine were great and I'll be back.
author: Amy L.

description: We love InoVino!  We go for happy hour and appetizers about 2-3 times a month.  The owner is wonderful, the food is fantastic as is the wine.  Service can be a challenge but the owner really helps out when the staff can't get to you and he is so charming. You do need to be willing to ask for help.  They should figure out that eventually.  This is a fabulous addition to Cole Valley.
author: Colleen K.

description: I was excited to visit InoVino with a girlfriend on Saturday evening - we loved everything about it!  It's cozy and friendly, dimly lit ... would be perfect for a date.  We each had one of their flights and shared some food.  Wine, food, and service were excellent!  And we enjoyed speaking with the very friendly owner Claudio.  I will definitely be back!
author: Marina T.

description: Terrificly interesting Italian wine list.  Staff is great at pairing glasses with food.  I'm a fan of their salads, the charcuterie plates and ALL of their desserts.  Great neighborhood vibe. Simply love this place.
author: Mera G.

description: It's one of my favorite places in the city. It's a jewel of a place. I haven't finished my goal of tasting everything on the menu, but everything I've had so far has been amazing. The service is always good, and the staff is very knowledgeable and happy to help if you are not too familiar with Italian wines. They also have 3 oz option for wine, which is great if you just want to sample a bit.
author: Yaroslava V.

description: We are semi-regulars at Ino Vino and absolutely love it. The wine selection is great, the staff are super-friendly and knowledgeable, and the ambience is adorable. Also, love the salads, cheeses, pizzettes, and the desserts. We recently went to another "Enoteca" in SF and made a pact to never go to a non-Ino Vino enoteca again because it simply doesn't compare. We love Ino Vino!
author: S. L.

description: This wine bar is one of the best in the city. Even though I am not a big fan of Itailan wines, Claudio has done a great job of selecting unusual wines that are delicious. And he has imported wonderful cheeses direct from Italy. Several friends and I went there after a disappointing wine dinner (four French wines, including a 1990 Margaux) and we had a great time. And we enjoyed the wines at InoVino much more and Claudio was a great host! I have known Claudio for over five years and enjoyed his hospitality first at Quattro (the restaurant at the Four Seasons in Silicon Valley) and then at Perbacco where he was wine director. He has used this experience well and I will be visiting InoVino the next time I am in SF.
author: Mark R.

description: A good addition to the neighborhood. Friendly service and helpful suggestions. It's a little tightly packed but the ambience is good. Generous and delicious trio of prosciutto but tiny (albeit delicious) trio of cheese. Maybe this place isn't quite sure if it's a wine bar with food or a small restaurant. Not a bargain but I think we'll go again (especially if the cheese portions can stretch beyond a mouthful).
author: Ian T.

description: A hidden jem of cole valley..amazing happy hour pizza and really good cheese platter with great selection of wine. very impressed and will look forward to coming back.
author: A S.
